headline: Salami, Cream Cheese, and Pepperoncini Roll-Ups
description: Quick little appetizer rolls of sliced salami with cream cheese and pepperoncini peppers will delight your guests, and you can whip them up in no time.

video.description: This video shows you how to make super-quick salami appetizer rolls. Cream cheese and sliced pepperoncini peppers are rolled up in slices of salami for a great snack or party appetizer. It's so simple!
video.name: Salami, Cream Cheese, and Pepperoncini Roll-Ups

name: Salami, Cream Cheese, and Pepperoncini Roll-Ups
recipeIngredient: 18 slices pepperoncini peppers, drained, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Spread about 1 1/2 teaspoon softened cream cheese over a slice of salami; top with 1 to 3 slices of pepperoncini pepper. Roll the salami around the cheese and pepper; secure with toothpick. Repeat with remaining ingredients; serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Yum + Me! These may not make it to the party. One tip: My salami was sliced a little too thin so that when I spread the creaam cheese on it, it would rip up. Too prevent this, I just cut open the peppers and stuffed them with cream cheese, then rolled it up with the salami. This also gives you the chance to seed the peppers, if you want, and kept the presentation a little cleaner.

I have been opting for this for a few years now for the app I bring to get-to-gethers. Typically, I am the one who travels and doesn't really have a kitchen of my own in the same day. I also am one person facing a big party, so this travels well, is affordable, and people always love it! I've used pepperoni or ham to roll in, but this one is always the fav. Also have cut whole peppers or bought sliced. Sliced is a whole lot less messy since you can just put a scoop of them into a paper towel or strainer to dry out. That's an important step so your treats don't get slimy or drippy. Cream, fat, salty, smokey, vinegar with a kick....not messy to enjoy, either. What's not to love?
These were good. I still prefer the ham and flavored cream cheese with a pickle roll up but these were a nice change. Good appetizer for Italian night! Easy to make.

I guess I was imagining that somehow these flavors would magically combine to get a rating fitting of what Iâ€™ve seen. Nope. Tastes like salami with pepperoncini and cream cheese. Nothing special and not even very good.
So easy and very tasty. No changes needed. Perfect quick appetizer.
Great flavor combination. I used whipped cream cheese and added some horseradish to half of the salami rolls. Everyone ate them up and no leftovers.
I personally did not like these, however everyone else raved about them so I will give them 5 stars. They are super easy to make too so that's always a plus!
A little putsy trying to keep together. They weren't as popular as the pickle roll ups. I won't make again.

I followed someone else's advice and chopped up the pepperoncini, mixed it in with the cream cheese and spread it on the salami. Make sure you get some of the cream cheese mixture to the edges of the salami. That way when you roll them up, they will adhere and you won't need a toothpick. They were delicious.

item.name: Salami, Cream Cheese, and Pepperoncini Roll-Ups
